                           Release Notes
-----------------------------------------------------------------

Comments :
This is another telling of the holocaust, but this time from the perspective 
of a modern teenage girl who only grudgingly accepts the Jewish traditions, 
but when she is asked to "open the front door" as part of the Seder feast 
finds herself, not unlike Dorothy in the Wizard of Oz, to have entered the 
1940&#039;s and has stepped into the life of a prisoner in one of the German death 
camps where she experiences all of its horrors firsthand.

Director : Donna Deitch

Writers: Jane Yolen (novel)
         Robert J. Avrech (teleplay)
